definition: to be eager to give sth a try (idiom)
to wish for/to desire/variant of 慾|欲[yu4]

sentences.english: He said, if this was the case, he would be tempted to try. ( adv . →v.
sentences.chinese: 他说，如果情况是这样，他颇有跃跃欲试之感。

sentences.english: The lawyers are, no doubt, rubbing their hands.
sentences.chinese: 毫无疑问，律师们正摩拳擦掌，跃跃欲试。

sentences.english: A young men and women and rejoice, bundles bright-coloured rose itch to try.
sentences.chinese: 一个个年轻男女欢欣鼓舞，一束束鲜艳玫瑰跃跃欲试。

sentences.english: The sales manager recently in power itched to hxdye a go at the East Asian market.
sentences.chinese: 新上任的销售经理跃跃欲试，要进军东亚市场。

sentences.english: Seeing these wonderful performances, many spectators might want to give it a try.
sentences.chinese: 看到这些精彩的武功表演，很多人可能也会跃跃欲试。

sentences.english: The sales manager recently in power itched to have a go at the East Asian market.
sentences.chinese: 新上任的销售经理跃跃欲试，要进军东亚市场。

sentences.english: Chu and all the tenants initiative, hear all buyers hedge try.
sentences.chinese: 楚慈和众租客倡议买楼保值，听得众人跃跃欲试。

sentences.english: The rowboat race won't begin until tomorrow, but the players have already itching to start today.
sentences.chinese: 明天划艇比赛才开始，今天选手就跃跃欲试了。

sentences.english: But developing countries are nevertheless raring to go.
sentences.chinese: 但是发展中国家仍然跃跃欲试。

definition: fig. to rub one's fists and wipe one's palms (idiom)/to roll up one's sleeves for battle/eager to get into action or start on a task
to begin to stir (idiom)/to get restless/to become threatening
to be unable to hold back
impatient (idiom); in a hurry/itching to get on with it
to become exhilarated (idiom); in high spirits/full of zest
to wait for action after having accumulated power, energy etc
happy and excited (idiom)/in high spirits/in great delight
